name: panmixia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
random breeding within a population (= when a member of a species breeds with any other member of its species): Panmixia may have a negative effect on ensuring the genetic diversity of a population. Our findings do not suggest panmixia among mite populations in eastern Australia.
More examplesFewer examplesGenome comparisons suggest that there was panmixia among the species.As a result of panmixia, we see fewer genetic distinctions in the species from the northern and southern parts of the continent.
